title: Thunderbird occasionally breaks a reply-to html stream resulting in html code being displayed to the recipient
content:
Is this exclusively an effect of my cutting text in a reply-to email for brevity of my reply ?

e.g.

>On 24/2/2024 8:41 am, Robin and Adrian [...] wrote:

> @font-face {font-family:"Cambria Math"; panose-1:2 4 5 3 5 4 6 3 2 4;}@font-face {font-family:Calibri; panose->1:2 15 5 2 2 2 4 3 2 4;}@font-face {font-family:Aptos;}p.MsoNormal, li.MsoNormal, div.MsoNormal {margin:0cm; >margin-bottom:.0001pt; font-size:12.0pt; font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;}a:link, span.MsoHyperlink {mso->style-priority:99; color:blue; text-decoration:underline;}a:visited, span.MsoHyperlinkFollowed {mso-style->priority:99; color:purple;

> ... etc etc for over a page long

I'm happy to try to replicate it if someone can offer suggestions.

[ using Thunderbird for Mac 115.8.0 (64-bit) but the issue is not new ]

many thanks for your support / suggestions

- rob d
creator: robert.r.dickinson

title: Cannot Add Multiple Outlook Accounts
content:
I've done this before multiple times but it seems to not work now and I'm at my wits end. I think trying to connect more than one outlook accounts is purely RNG at this point. I study and work in a college and need to access to the two emails being used from the schools mail server on my Linux machine.

The problem is that both require Oauth2 and and a seperate login scnreen, I've gotten both, at the same installation, to work multiple times before. But its purely by luck and with no connection to how it didn't break that time around.

I saw a post saying to change the names of the server but that's no longer working, and one saying to use 'smtp-mail.office.com' for one, 'smtp.office365.com' for the other nut no matter in which order ior amount i use those servers its still not working.

Is it possible that Thunderbird sandboxes the accounts properly, and it actually doesn't use the same SMTP server from another account?

Does anyone have any solution to this?
creator: otegaid

title: Login to server mail.tpg.com.au with username XXXXXXX failed.
content: Since 2pm AU yesterday, I'm getting the message "Login to server mail.tpg.com.au with username XXXXXXX failed". I have tried everything in checking password, settings but nothing is working. TPG has been back online since this morning, but my Thunderbird is not working. Thanks in advance for any help you can provide.

title: Sending Emails
content: I sent you a note on Feb22nd explaining that I am having problems sending emails,incoming no problems.I am still encountering the same problems to a certain extent.You did send me a reply,however I have to admit that due to my lack of knowledge I failed to understand.This morning I tried to send a "test" message to a friend.It failed with the message "the message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server(SMTP-mail.outlook.com) timed out. However I saved the message to my drafts folder pressed Send and the message went to my friend.Following this I repeated the process with another test,that also was sent. I would appreciate greatly any advice or help you can offer me
creator: malcolmlove

title: Assign a category to all events in a calendar
content:
Hi,

For a few years now, I've separated all of my events into multiple calendars. There's a calendar called "School", one called "Social Events", one called "Family" etc.

Now, I need to merge all of these calendars together to make syncing easier, but at the same time, I need to keep the events distinguishable from each other based on the calendar of their origin. I need to use categories for this, as far as I know.

Now the question is, how do I select all events in one calendar, assign all of them a certain category and then move all of them to one new "Merged" calendar?

I tried asking AI and it seems like Thunderbird doesn't support it. If it was correct, are there some workarounds to do this, for example, some open-source scripts to modify the exported ICS files and set the categories in them?

Thanks.
creator: ShadyMedic
